channel.title: Learning GUI for my simulation, need some help

item.title: Learning GUI for my simulation, need some help
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

You are declaring a basic JFrame with no components. So by default, it is just a white screen. I would recommend downloading net beans and using their gui builder if you are simply just doing this for an assignment and not for the educational portion of it.

Read full topic
item.source: Learning GUI for my simulation, need some help

item.title: Learning GUI for my simulation, need some help
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I am working on a simulation on Reverse Osmosis and I need some help with my GUI part as my knowledge in GUI is not extensive. Here is my GUI class, what do I do now that it loads a white screen? AtomicInt_ has been helping me with this aswell and we both donâ€™t know much in this specific area of java. [code=java]package ReverseOsmosis;

import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.FocusEvent;
import java.awt.event.FocusListener;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.URL;

import javax.swing.JFrame;

public class Gui implements ActionListener, FocusListener {

private JFrame frame;
private String frameTitle = "Reverse Osmosis";

public void init() {
	frame = new JFrame(frameTitle);
	frame.setVisible(true);
	frame.setResizable(false);
	frame.setLocationRelativeTo(null);
	frame.setSize(756, 503);
}

public Gui(String[] args) {
	super();
	init();
}

public URL getDocumentBase() throws IOException {
	return new URL("willbeusedlater.com");
}

@Override
public void focusGained(FocusEvent arg0) {

}

@Override
public void focusLost(FocusEvent arg0) {

}

@Override
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent arg) {

}

}[/code]
